oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-03-31 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 31, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Carl Smith (host/performer), guest performer Red Sovine (although Goldie Hill was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Louie Dunn, Lew Childre, Moon Mullican, Minnie Pearl, and Chet Atkins. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Carl Smith; Moon Mullican; Minnie Pearl; Red Sovine; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Carl Smith) [continued from part 1] -- Prince Albert jingle (Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith introduces Moon Mullican -- Pipeliner Blues (Moon Mullican) -- Carl Smith introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith introduces Red Sovine -- Little Rosa (Red Sovine) -- Carl Smith introduces Chet Atkins -- Tennessee Polka (Chet Atkins) -- Carl Smith talks -- If You Do Dear (Carl Smith) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Carl Smith) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Mullican, Moon, 1909-1967; Huskey, Junior (Roy Madison); Dunn, Louie; Smith, Carl, 1927-2010; Sovine, Red
